p: Viral replication is also accompanied by upregulated levels of inflammatory cytokines (such as IL-6, MCP1 (CCL2), IP-10 (CXCL10), MIG (CXCL9), IL1β, and tumor necrosis factor (TNFα)) in the plasma of acutely infected CHIKV patients and NHPs [ 116, 122, 123, 124, 125, 126, 127]. Notably, IL-6, IL-1b, and TNFα are pyrogenic cytokines contributing to fever [ 128], and are implicated in persistence and tissue destruction during arthralgia [ 122, 128, 129]. IL-6 is also a marker of poor prognosis, together with IL1β and RANTES [ 128].
